column4: you can mount ISOs and run the installer from there. Really not sure whether this would install fine
The installer needs to commit changes to the partition table, but cannot do so because partitions on the following mount point could not be unmounted: /cdrom
$ sudo umount /cdrom umount: /cdrom: device is busy.         (In some cases useful info about processes that use          the device is found by lsof(8) or fuser(1))
you tried lsof/fuser to check if something is using /cdrom ?
I have also tried to boot the live using the "toram" parameter to free the /cdrom
Yeah, but I mean just "lsof | grep cdrom" should do the trick ?
I suppose; i didn't use lsof in a while
can you remove /cdrom mount line in /etc/fstab ? Maybe then it won't automount it
There is no /cdrom in the fstab
Not sure how to help you then. Mayb udev is automounting cdrom
maybe you have a CD in? haha
No, no CD, I think the system is tricked, because it's booted from an ISO on my HDD (and the iso SHOULD be a CD)

silverarrow : I finally found a USB drive (my old iPod I almost never use), but I can't mount it ("The daemon is inhibited" from the GUI, and from the CLI: "mount: can't find /dev/disk/by-label/XINPOD in /etc/fstab or /etc/mtab"
you specified so few parameters that it has to look in fstab. Add mount options and mountpoint. check man mount
